data.name: Temperature Calibration
data.description: Calibrate the optimal printing temperature for your filament
data.intro: Calibrating the optimal printing temperature for your filament is a crucial step in ensuring the best possible print quality. By following this guide, you'll learn how to calibrate the optimal printing temperature for your filament using OrcaSlicer.

steps.title: Getting Started
steps.description: Lets get started by opening OrcaSlicer and creating a new project, then selecting the filament we want to calibrate inside of OrcaSlicer.

steps.title: Print A Temperature Tower
steps.description: Printing a temperature tower will help you calibrate the optimal printing temperature for your filament. Inside of OrcaSlicer, create a new project > select calibration > temperature.

steps.title: Enter Your Optimal Temperature
steps.description: After examining your temperature tower print, determine which temperature section produced the best results and enter that temperature below.

data.name: Flow Calibration
data.description: Calibrate the optimal flow for your filament

steps.title: Calibrate the optimal flow for your filament
steps.description: Calibrate the optimal printing flow for your filament
